description:
YouTube’s Product Partnerships team accelerates the global growth and innovation of YouTube products by driving new business opportunities through partnerships. We own the business side of new features, products and initiatives that are vital to the success of YouTube. As a team member, you understand the landscape of partnerships opportunities across technology licensing/integrations, marketing, and distribution. You will also craft strategies, define and structure critical partnerships, negotiate agreements, and cultivate our relationships.

The YouTube Video Infrastructure team is responsible for delivering an excellent YouTube experience to its end users so that they can enjoy their favorite videos rather than watch the rebuffer wheel. There are many ecosystem partners that are critical to delivering this great experience, including mobile and fixed line network operators, network equipment vendors, and video codec partners such as chipset manufacturers.

As a Product Partnerships Manager, you’ll work closely with the Product and Engineering teams to identify opportunities to improve the experience of YouTube users. By working with partners, you’ll help define and drive improvements in key business and user experience metrics, contributing experience in partnerships management and a thoughtful, strategic approach to how we partner. You possess a global perspective and work well in a fast-paced, ever-evolving, team-oriented environment.

At YouTube, we believe that everyone deserves to have a voice, and that the world is a better place when we listen, share, and build community through our stories. We work together to give everyone the power to share their story, explore what they love, and connect with one another in the process. Working at the intersection of cutting-edge technology and boundless creativity, we move at the speed of culture with a shared goal to show people the world. We explore new ideas, solve real problems, and have fun — and we do it all together.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or 10 years of equivalent practical experience.
  • 10 years of experience in partnership development and partner management, identifying partners, structuring and negotiating agreements.
  • 6 years of experience working with Product, Engineering, and Legal teams in a technology environment.
  • 2 years of experience in people management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA.
  • Experience operating within and leading cross-functional efforts across Product, Engineering, Legal, Policy, Operations, etc. Experience working in the mobile telecommunications industry.
  • Experience handling sensitive partnerships. Experience in a consulting role. Ability to quickly learn new technologies. Passion for and understanding YouTube products.
  • Ability to quickly learn new technologies. Passion for and understanding YouTube products.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and business judgment. Excellent collaboration skills with a creative approach.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to formulate and articulate contractual, technical, financial and business points with partners and internal teams.
responsibilities:
• Become a domain expert and thought leader in the video infrastructure space. Define the vision, set the strategy, and manage objectives and deliverables for driving partnerships and evaluating growth.
  • Develop and maintain strategic partnerships with mobile operators, fixed line operators, and network equipment vendors, including sourcing partners, structuring and negotiating agreements, and partner management.
  • Set cadence and communication channels for program activities to the cross-functional organization. Present key updates to leadership.
  • Lead cross-functionally to secure buy-in for the program and partnerships, including problem-solving legal, policy, business, operational and technical complexities. Collaborate with other Google teams that work in this space.
  • People management
title: Product Partnerships Manager, Video Infrastructure, YouTube
